name: nanofuzz
description: NaNofuzz is a fast and easy-to-use automatic test suite generator for TypeScript that runs inside VS Code
author: The NaNofuzz Team @ Carnegie Mellon University

nanofuzz.fuzzer.maxTests.title: Maximum number of tests
nanofuzz.fuzzer.maxTests.description: Maximum number of tests the fuzzer should run before stopping.

nanofuzz.fuzzer.maxDupeInputs.title: Maximum number of duplicate inputs
nanofuzz.fuzzer.maxDupeInputs.description: Maximum number of duplicate inputs the fuzzer should generate before stopping.

nanofuzz.fuzzer.maxFailures.title: Maximum number of failures (0=no limit)
nanofuzz.fuzzer.maxFailures.description: Maximum number of failed tests the fuzzer should run before stopping.

nanofuzz.fuzzer.suiteTimeout.title: Maximum time to run the fuzzer (ms)
nanofuzz.fuzzer.suiteTimeout.description: Maximum time (in ms) to allow the fuzzer to run before stopping.

nanofuzz.fuzzer.fnTimeout.title: Timeout test after (ms)
nanofuzz.fuzzer.fnTimeout.description: Maximum time (in ms) to allow a test function to run before making it as a timeout.

nanofuzz.ui.codeLens.includeValidators.title: Show 'NaNofuzz' button for property validator functions?
nanofuzz.ui.codeLens.includeValidators.description: Show 'NaNofuzz' button for property validator functions?

nanofuzz.ui.codeLens.ignoreFilePattern.title: Regex of files for NaNofuzz to ignore
nanofuzz.ui.codeLens.ignoreFilePattern.description: Regex of files for NaNofuzz to ignore

nanofuzz.argdef.strCharset.title: String character set
nanofuzz.argdef.strCharset.description: Characters to select from when randomly generating string inputs

nanofuzz.argdef.strLength.min.title: Minimum string length
nanofuzz.argdef.strLength.min.description: Minimum length of a randomly-generated input string

nanofuzz.argdef.strLength.max.title: Maximum string length
nanofuzz.argdef.strLength.max.description: Maximum length of a randomly-generated input string

nanofuzz.argdef.numInteger.title: Generate integer inputs?
nanofuzz.argdef.numInteger.description: Generate integers as numeric inputs by default?

nanofuzz.argdef.numSigned.title: Generate signed inputs?
nanofuzz.argdef.numSigned.description: Generate signed values as numeric inputs by default?

nanofuzz.argdef.dftDimLength.min.title: Minimum array length
nanofuzz.argdef.dftDimLength.min.description: Minimum array length generate by default.

nanofuzz.argdef.dftDimLength.max.title: Maximum array length
nanofuzz.argdef.dftDimLength.max.description: Minimum array length generate by default.

nanofuzz.argdef.anyType.title: Treat any types as
nanofuzz.argdef.anyType.description: Default type of any type arguments.

nanofuzz.argdef.anyDims.title: Array dimensions for any types
nanofuzz.argdef.anyDims.description: Default number of array dimensions for any types.  0=not an array.
